meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: It's Not Game 7, but It'll Have to Do José Reyes and the Mets battered the St. Louis Cardinals, the defending World Series champions, 6-1, in the season opener.
SPORTSMONDAY, PAGE D1

4 G.I.'s Among Dead in Iraq Attacks in Iraq killed at least two dozen people, including four American soldiers who were responding to an earlier bombing that killed two other American soldiers late Saturday. In Baghdad, Senator John McCain said the security plan was ''making progress.''
PAGE A11
Bid for Credit-Card Processor First Data, one of the nation's largest credit-card processors, is near a deal to be sold for nearly $27 billion to the private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts.
PAGE A21
Banning Investment in Iran A bill in the California Legislature would force two of the nation's largest pension funds to remove their money from foreign companies doing business in Iran.
PAGE A14
Clinton Fund-Raising Edge Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton's campaign said it had raised $26 million in the first quarter, three times as much as the previous record at this stage of the race.
PAGE A18
Rutgers Will Play for Title Rutgers routed L.S.U. to earn a spot in the women's N.C.A.A. championship game against Tennessee, which defeated North Carolina.
SPORTSMONDAY, PAGE D1
It's Not Game 7, but It'll Have to Do José Reyes and the Mets battered the St. Louis Cardinals, the defending World Series champions, 6-1, in the season opener.
SPORTSMONDAY, PAGE D1

4 G.I.'s Among Dead in Iraq Attacks in Iraq killed at least two dozen people, including four American soldiers who were responding to an earlier bombing that killed two other American soldiers late Saturday. In Baghdad, Senator John McCain said the security plan was ''making progress.''
PAGE A11
Bid for Credit-Card Processor First Data, one of the nation's largest credit-card processors, is near a deal to be sold for nearly $27 billion to the private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts.
PAGE A21
Banning Investment in Iran A bill in the California Legislature would force two of the nation's largest pension funds to remove their money from foreign companies doing business in Iran.
PAGE A14
Clinton Fund-Raising Edge Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton's campaign said it had raised $26 million in the first quarter, three times as much as the previous record at this stage of the race.
PAGE A18
Rutgers Will Play for Title Rutgers routed L.S.U. to earn a spot in the women's N.C.A.A. championship game against Tennessee, which defeated North Carolina.
SPORTSMONDAY, PAGE D1
